biography.value:
A troll that survives massive doses of poison might transform into a venom troll. Lingering poison infuses the troll’s blood and tissue, and poison leaks from the pores to coat the troll’s fangs and claws. These creatures are especially dangerous in close combat because poison drips off their flesh and sprays out from every wound they receive.

Trolls

Trolls that are nearly obliterated but survive and regenerate from mere scraps of flesh can display bizarre features. Radically transformed trolls like the rot troll;rot trolls, spirit troll;spirit trolls, and venom trolls that follow are especially likely to arise when trolls regenerate in the presence of magical emanations, planar energy, disease, or death on a vast scale, or if their bodies were damaged by elemental forces. These unusual forms can also be produced and shaped by the ritual magic of evil spellcasters or by trolls’ own practices, as is the case for dire troll;dire trolls.

Vaprak the Destroyer

Although trolls are rarely devout and seldom ponder spiritual questions, some fear and venerate the entity known as Vaprak the Destroyer. Vaprak’s true nature is something of a mystery, but Vaprak is always portrayed as a horrid, misshapen, greenish creature strongly resembling a troll. Vaprak is given to fits of mindless destruction and uncontrollably fears the plots and ambitions of other deities.

Vaprak’s troll worshipers believe this god devours the souls of those who have been cooked or digested (slain by fire or acid). Otherwise, the god spits the soul back into the world to regenerate a new body.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse
Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The troll makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 1d8 type=poison average=true]] damage, and the target is &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} until the start of the troll’s next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d6 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 1d8 type=poison average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The troll slices itself with a claw, releasing a spray of &Reference[poison]{poison} in a 15-foot &Reference[cube]{cube}. The troll takes [[/damage 2d6 type=slashing average=true]] damage, which can’t be reduced in any way. Each creature in the area must make a [[/save con 16 format=long]]. On a failed save, a creature takes [[/damage 4d8 type=poison average=true]] damage and is &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn’t &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned}. A &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

changes.value: turn=end, saveAbility=con, saveDC=@abilities.str.dc, label=Poisoned by Venom Spray

macro.name: Venom Spray

description.value:
&Reference[poison]{Poison} Splash. When the troll takes damage of any type but &Reference[psychic]{psychic}, each creature within 5 feet of the troll takes [[/damage 2d8 type=poison average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

macro.name: Poison Splash

description.value:
Regeneration. The troll regains [[/damage 10 type=heal average=false]] hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes &Reference[acid]{acid} or &Reference[fire]{fire} damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the troll’s next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

changes.value: turn=start, damageRoll=+ 10, damageType=healing, condition=@attributes.hp.value > 0 && @attributes.hp.value < @attributes.hp.max, rollMode=gmroll, label=Regeneration (Fire or Acid prevents)
